cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 179 (Wednesday, December 4, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CONNOLLY:H.R. 10285.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:To amend Chapter 63 of title 5, United States Code, tomodify the accumulation of annual leave for use in succeedingyears for administrative law judges.The single subject of this legislation is:This bill aims to modify the limits on accumulation ofannual leave for administratve law judges by adding anadministrative law judge position under section 3105.[Page H6362]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

bill.title: To amend chapter 63 of title 5, United States Code, to modify the accumulation of annual leave for use in succeeding years for administrative law judges.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
